intro: Pleiotaxis amoena, commonly known as the pink fairy tern, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas with good drainage.
